document_data.name: Sumihiro Matsutomo
document_data.mainbody: '''Sumihiro Matsutomo''' was a [[samurai]] and a member of the [[Matsutomo]] clan in the town of [[Aru]] in [[Wa]] in the 1770s on the [[Wa Calendar]].
document_data.Description: He was ugly and was aged almost 40 in {{YearlinkConvert|1775|WY}}.
document_data.Personality: Sumihiro had a sullen attitude and was very uncharismatic.
document_data.Relations: Sumihiro was the nephew of [[Benju Matsutomo]], the [[daimyo]] of [[Aru Province]], and one of the members of his court. He was viewed as a disgrace to the family.As [[Takako Shimizu]] is Benju's niece and is described as "differentâ€¦ in almost every way", it seems intended that Sumihiro and Takako are siblings or half-siblings.
document_data.Abilities: He was specialized in his [[katana]] and proficient in [[horse]]manship, calligraphy, and poetry. However, he was incredibly clumsy and poor samurai despite decades of quality training.
document_data.Possessions: Though he always had his katana and wakizashi with him, he was not known to have drawn them for years. He never donned armor.
document_data.History: In high summer of {{YearlinkConvert|1775|WY}}, Sumihiro, Benju, various local nobility, and a group of adventurers hired by the daimyo gathered one evening on the vantage point on the hill north of Aru, beside the [[Shining Temple of Bishamon]]. The evening was ruined when the temple's great [[brass]] bell broke as the hour was rung.
